Poetic Translation: All the gables shed the rain;
This rain is pouring from them.
As I stand here, I am drenched.

Direct Translation: open the door of the hall
Poetic Translation: The door I beg you open.

Direct Translation: no lock is there at all
Poetic Translation: Nor a bar, no, have I to fasten,

Direct Translation: push it open and come in
Poetic Translation: Just push it open, love, and come in,
For I am no one else's.

Transliteration: Markham, Elizabeth. Saibara: Japanese Court Songs of the Heian Period. Vol. 2. Cambridge: Cambridge UP, 1983. Print.
